intro: Taonabo monticola, commonly known as the mountain taonabo, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with high altitude and moderate rainfall. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Taonabo monticola is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its high-altitude environment.
